description: Bryce Dallas Howard looked stunning in a shimmering metallic blue gown and made sure to stand out from the crowd on the red carpet at the 73rd Golden Globe Awards
title: Golden Globes 2016 red carpet sees Bryce Dallas Howard dazzle in blue
title_page: Golden Globes 2016 red carpet sees Bryce Dallas Howard dazzle in blue | Daily Mail Online
text:
Bryce Dallas Howard looked stunning in a shimmering metallic blue gown.
The 34-year-old made sure to stand out from the crowd on the red carpet at the Golden Globe Awards in Beverly Hills on Sunday.
She looked regal in the elegant, full-length number with sheer lace neckline and cinched waist.
Scroll down for video
Dazzling! Bryce Dallas Howard, 34, looked stunning in a shimmering metallic blue gown at the 73rd Golden Globe Awards in Beverly Hills on Sunday
Howard donned the chic dress which included hints of black intertwined within the sparkling textured fabric.
She accessorized her look with a matching royal blue clutch and wore vintage diamond and topaz jeweled drop earrings.
Her strawberry blonde hair was sleek and straight, and hit just past her shoulders with her bangs swept to one side and tucked behind her ear.
See more of the latest Golden Globes 2016 news, red carpet pictures and video updates
Showstopping! The Golden Globe nominee accessorized her look with a matching royal blue clutch and wore vintage diamond and topaz jeweled drop earrings
The Jurassic World actress kept her makeup neutral and let her showstopping garb take centre stage.
Bryce has much to celebrate recently as it was announced last year that her hugely successful dinosaur park film will release a sequel, set to be released in 2018.
Howard will return to star in the film as Claire, the park's operations manager.
Majestic! The strawberry blonde beauty looked regal in the elegant, full-length number with sheer lace neckline and cinched waist
After a record-breaking opening weekend at the time, Jurassic World stands as the fourth-highest-grossing film of all time, as well as the second-highest-grossing film of 2015.
The mother-of-two also played doting daughter last month as she showed support while her father Ron Howard received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for his directorial work.
Howard already has a star for his TV work - one of the five categories for which they are awarded.
Bryce's record-breaker! Howard has much to celebrate recently as it was announced last year that her hugely successful dinosaur park film will release a sequel, set to be released in 2018
Doting daughter! The mother-of-two showed support while her father Ron Howard received a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame for his directorial work
